docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Six Fois Sept
docs.text:
As specialists in Data Science, we develop robust and reliable methods for building data assets. We convert your data into usable, readable information geared towards decision-making. Our work in artificial intelligence is done with a collaborative approach, allowing for a shared vision of objectives and results.

We promote a more popular vision of Data Science, while utilizing robust algorithms.

Since January 2021, the APAVE group has taken a 50% stake in SixFoisSept’s capital.

Info

Visit our website: www.sixfoissept.com/ Contact: contact@sixfoissept.com Location: Paris II

docs.title: An ethical society
docs.text:
SixFoisSept is a company built on two fundamentals. Technical excellence in DataScience methods and tools on the one hand and ethics on the other.

We built the SixFoisSept project by writing Data For Good into our DNA. We carry out our projects on a fair, ethical basis and without black boxes. We invest part of our profits in causes that we believe are right (the fight against cancer for years or the program of access to school for disadvantaged children “Freedom Through Education” in Nepal).

SixFoisSept is a signatory of the “Hippocratic Oath for DataScience” charter.

docs.title: The product documentation
docs.text:
If you want to get detailed information about 'My Package,' you can check the My Package section.

For more information about building charts and tables, check the Graphs & Tables section.

docs.title: API Reference of my_package
docs.text:
quick_math.py

This module contains functions for basic mathematical operations.

Functions: - add_numbers: Adds two numbers. - subtract_numbers: Subtracts the second number from the first. - multiply_numbers: Multiplies two numbers. - divide_numbers: Divides the first number by the second.

Usage: import quick_math

result = quick_math.add_numbers(2, 3)
print(result)  # Output: 5

docs.title: add_numbers(a, b)
docs.text:
Adds two numbers.

Parameters: - a (int or float): The first number. - b (int or float): The second number.

Returns: int or float: The sum of the two numbers.

Source code in src\quick_math.py 
def add_numbers(a, b):
    """
    Adds two numbers.

    Parameters:
    - a (int or float): The first number.
    - b (int or float): The second number.

    Returns:
    int or float: The sum of the two numbers.
    """
    return a + b

docs.title: divide_numbers(a, b)
docs.text:
Divides the first number by the second.

Parameters: - a (int or float): The numerator. - b (int or float): The denominator (must not be zero).

Returns: float: The result of dividing the first number by the second.

Source code in src\quick_math.py 
def divide_numbers(a, b):
    """
    Divides the first number by the second.

    Parameters:
    - a (int or float): The numerator.
    - b (int or float): The denominator (must not be zero).

    Returns:
    float: The result of dividing the first number by the second.
    """
    if b == 0:
        raise ValueError("Division by zero is not allowed.")
    return a / b

docs.title: multiply_numbers(a, b)
docs.text:
Multiplies two numbers.

Parameters: - a (int or float): The first number. - b (int or float): The second number.

Returns: int or float: The product of the two numbers.

Source code in src\quick_math.py 
def multiply_numbers(a, b):
    """
    Multiplies two numbers.

    Parameters:
    - a (int or float): The first number.
    - b (int or float): The second number.

    Returns:
    int or float: The product of the two numbers.
    """
    return a * b

docs.title: subtract_numbers(a, b)
docs.text:
Subtracts the second number from the first.

Parameters: - a (int or float): The first number. - b (int or float): The second number.

Returns: int or float: The result of subtracting the second number from the first.

Source code in src\quick_math.py 
def subtract_numbers(a, b):
    """
    Subtracts the second number from the first.

    Parameters:
    - a (int or float): The first number.
    - b (int or float): The second number.

    Returns:
    int or float: The result of subtracting the second number from the first.
    """
    return a - b

docs.title: Mermaid
docs.text:
Mermaid permet de décrire des schémas en symboles qui seront traduits au rendu de la page web.

Source : mermaid

docs.title: Diagrammes
docs.text:
Documentation : mermaid

flowchart LR
A(mon API) <-->|récupération des codes|B[(B)]
A -->|appel avec les codes| C(une autre API)
C -- Une autre façon de faire un lien --> D[Autre chose]
D <== Lien plus épais ==> B

docs.title: Diagrammes de séquence
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
mon API ->> Une autre API: GET /informations
Une autre API -->> mon API: Les informations
Note over mon API,Une autre API: Une demande d'informations
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
mon API ->> Une autre API: GET /informations
Une autre API -->> mon API: Les informations
Note over mon API,Une autre API: Une demande d'informations
```

sequenceDiagram
actor A as Utilisateur
participant B as API B
participant C as API C
participant D as Service D
A->>B: Recherche d'informations
loop Chaque minute
    B-->A: Les voilà
end
A->>C: Autres infos
C->>D: Infos partielles
D-)C: Infos
C-)A: Informations
Note right of D: Appel au 6x7
Note over B,C: Pas d'appel direct au 6x7
Note over A,B: Une autre note

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
actor A as Utilisateur
participant B as API B
participant C as API C
participant D as Service D
A->>B: Recherche d'informations
loop Chaque minute
    B-->A: Les voilà
end
A->>C: Autres infos
C->>D: Infos partielles
D-)C: Infos
C-)A: Informations
Note right of D: Appel au 6x7
Note over B,C: Pas d'appel direct au 6x7
Note over A,B: Une autre note
```
